Key Match Events: David Brooks opened the scoring early on to give Wales the ideal leg-up.
Neco Williams scored an unstoppable free-kick.
Daniel James rounded the Finland goalkeeper and captain, Lukas Hradecky, after a calamitous error by a dawdling Miro Tenho.
Teemu Pukki scored before the break for Finland.
Brennan Johnson’s strike two minutes into the second half took the heat out of the tie.
Post-Match Reflections: At the final whistle there was a warm outpouring of applause, a communal acknowledgment of a job well done.
Rob Page, the Wales manager, was at pains to say the next few days are tantamount to the half-time interval.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wales have now won each of their last three playoffs in Cardiff.
If Wales beat Poland in the final on Tuesday, they will secure a place at the Euro 2024 finals in Germany.
Robert Lewandowski was not on the scoresheet in Poland's semi-final against Estonia.
